= Tungsten Replication for MySQL users =

MySQL replication is very well known and understood. Comparatively, Tungsten replication is quite young and unknown.
To close the gap, we offer a quick glossary of MySQL commands or actions with the corresponding Tungsten items.

----
This is work in progress. Please check this page from time to time as we will add more content.
----

== Setting replication ==

|| *Action* || *MySQL* || *Tungsten* ||
|| defining replication relations || `CHANGE MASTER TO master_host=x` || `./configure-service --create --role=slave --master-host=x` ||
|| starting replication, data transfer|| `START SLAVE IO_THREAD` || `trepctl -service name start` ||
|| starting replication, data applier || `START SLAVE SQL_THREAD`|| `trepctl -service name online` ||
|| Stopping replication applier || `STOP SLAVE SQL_THREAD` || `trepctl -service name offline` ||
|| Stopping replication || `STOP SLAVE` || `trepctl -service name stop` ||

== Maintenance ==
|| *Action* || *MySQL* || *Tungsten* ||
|| Checking master status || `SHOW MASTER STATUS` || `trepctl -host master_host status`||
|| Checking slave status || `SHOW SLAVE STATUS` || `trepctl -host slave_host status` ||
|| " || " || `trepctl status -name shards` ||
|| " || " || `trepctl status -name tasks` ||
|| inspecting a binary log || `mysqlbinlog binlog_name` || `mysqlbinlog binlog_name` ||
|| inspecting a relay log || `mysqlbinlog relay_log_name` || `thl -service name list` ||
|| Skipping a statement || `set global  sql_slave_skip_counter =N` || `trepctl -service name online -skip N `|| 
|| slave lag || Look at `Seconds behind master` in `SHOW SLAVE STATUS` || look for `appliedLatency` in `trepctl status` ||
